gov.nih.nlm.ling.transform

Class PPAttachmentCorrection

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.nih.nlm.ling.transform.PPAttachmentCorrection
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DependencyTransformation

    public class PPAttachmentCorrection
extends java.lang.Object
implements DependencyTransformation
    A DependencyTransformation implementation that attempts to corect PP-attachment errors often made by Stanford Parser.

    It currently uses simple wordlists for different prepositions harvested from the BioNLP shared task data as well as Schuman and Bergler (2006) heuristcs. The wordlists can be generalized using the syntactic restrictions in SPECIALIST Lexicon or such.

    Author:
    Halil Kilicoglu

    • Constructor Detail

      • PPAttachmentCorrection

        public PPAttachmentCorrection()
        The default constructor. Takes in a pre-defined list of lemmas to apply pp reattachment to. The list is primarily based on the BioNLP Shared task.

      • PPAttachmentCorrection

        public PPAttachmentCorrection(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.List<java.lang.String>> prepTypes)
        Takes in a pre-defined map of dependency type/lemma list pairs to apply pp reattachment to. The key values should be in the 'prep_X' format, where X is a preposition (e.g., 'prep_on'). Ideally prepTypes should be created from the syntactic information in the dictionary.
        Parameters:
        prepTypes - a map of dependency type/lemma lists

    • Method Detail

      • getPrerequisites

        public java.util.List<java.lang.Class<? extends DependencyTransformation>> getPrerequisites()
        Description copied from interface: DependencyTransformation
        Gets the dependency transformation rules that should have been applied before applying the current one.

        This is because the current rule assumes a dependency configuration generated by the prerequisite rule.

        Specified by:
        getPrerequisites in interface DependencyTransformation
        Returns:
        the prerequisite dependency transformation rules, or empty list if no prerequisites

      • getPrepTypes

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.List<java.lang.String>> getPrepTypes()

      • transform

        public void transform(Sentence sent)
        Transforms a sentence by re-attaching prepositional phrases.

        The transformation takes place in two steps:

        • Applying the PP-attachment rules defined in Schuman and Bergler (2006).
        • Re-attaching the PPs to the nearest nominalization that acts as an object, if the nominalization is in a predefined list of nominalizations used in BioNLP shared tasks.
        Specified by:
        transform in interface DependencyTransformation
        Parameters:
        sent - the sentence to transform
